title: Law and Economics
description: To introduce students to economic aspects of legal decision-making and to develop students' ability to critically analyze the purposes and efficiency of legal decision-making from an economic perspective.
restrictions: __HEADER_0__Must be enrolled in one of the following Campuses:
prerequisites: ECON 2100 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of D or ECON 2101 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of D or ECON 2106 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of D
